alert.note: Alert for Warren (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 1:36AM EDT until further notice by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Schroon River At Riverbank. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Water reaches minor flood stage with water in nearby lowlands and outbuildings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 6.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening and continue rising to 7.4 feet early Saturday afternoon. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.3 feet on 04/24/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Schroon River Riverbank Flood Stage: 7.0 Observed Stage at Thu 1 am: 6.7 Forecast: Thu 2 am 6.8 Thu 8 am 6.9 Thu 2 pm 6.9 Thu 8 pm 7.0 Fri 2 am 7.1 Fri 8 am 7.2 Fri 2 pm 7.2 Fri 8 pm 7.3 Sat 2 am 7.3 Sat 8 am 7.3 Sat 2 pm 7.4 Sat 8 pm 7.4 &&
